page.title: 19The View from our School
page.content: We are very lucky at our school as we have a beautiful view from 6 out of the 8 classrooms. The land around Exmouth slopes gently up from the sea in a NE direction and Brixington School is nearly on top of a hill, half a Km from Woodbury Common. On a clear day you can see as far as{Berry {Head}near{Brixham}and up the coast to {Torquay, Teignmouth, Dawlish Warren and on up the{Exe estuary.}At night the view is scattered with thousands of lights shining in each town on the far coast and the lighthouse on Berry Head winks in the distance. Inland from the coast we can see the{Haldon {Hills.}Exmouth town centre is about 3 Km from school but looks much closer as we are up above it. We watch ships in{Lyme Bay}waiting to enter{Exmouth {docks}and small motor boats and dinghies moored off{Shelly Beach.
